alert.note: Alert for Rock (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 8:02PM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Minnesota and central, east central, south central and southeast South Dakota. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Saturday. For the Blizzard Warning, until 6 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow will result in whiteout conditions in open areas. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions will continue through early Friday afternoon. Travel has become treacherous. Any person that becomes stranded or trapped outdoors could encounter a life- threatening situation in a short amount of time.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
